parse.title: List of countries with KFC franchises

text.*:
Kentucky Fried Chicken (KFC)
A KFC location in Harrisburg, Illinois.
Type
 Subsidiary
Industry Restaurants
Genre Fast food restaurant
Founded
  • Sanders Court & Café:
    March 20, 1930; 88 years ago (1930-03-20)
    North Corbin, Kentucky
  • First franchise:
    September 24, 1952 (1952-09-24)
    Salt Lake City, Utah
Founder Harland Sanders
Headquarters 1441 Gardiner Lane
Louisville, Kentucky, U.S.
Number of locations
 20,952[1] (2015)
Key people
  • Greg Creed (Yum! Brands Chairman and CEO)[2]
  • Roger Eaton (Yum! COO and KFC President)[2]
Products
  • Fried chicken
  • Chicken sandwiches
  • Wraps
  • French fries
  • Soft drinks
  • Salads
  • Desserts
  • Breakfast
  • Krushems (Milkshakes)
Revenue US$23 billion (2013)[3]
Parent
  • Yum! Brands worldwide outside of China
  • Yum China within China
Website

www.kfc.com

This box:
  • view
  • talk
  • edit

This is a listing of countries with KFC franchises. As of year end 2014, there are 18,875 KFC outlets in 119 countries and territories across the world.[4][5] The first KFC franchise opened in the United States in 1952, and in Canada a year later. The first overseas franchise was established in the United Kingdom in 1974. A large number of Caribbean and developed Western markets entered by the early 1970s. This was followed by expansion throughout the Middle East and developed Asian markets from the mid-1970s and into the 1980s. China was entered in 1987. Expansions were made into most of Europe countries and South America in the early 1990s. The most recent area of expansion is Africa, where the company is targeting that continent's growing middle class.

The major markets for KFC include China (4,563 units), the United States (4,491 units), Japan (1,181 units), the United Kingdom (900 units), South Africa (736 units), Canada (663 units), Australia (618 units), Russia (608 units), Malaysia (579 units) and Thailand (531 units).

The global operations are overseen by Yum International, which is headquartered in Louisville, Kentucky. Yum! typically grant a master franchise to a local operator, or take a stake in a joint venture between such a company and itself. In 11 locations, Yum! International manages KFC directly, including China, Russia and India.[6] Worldwide, major franchise holders range from large local conglomerates such as Jardine Matheson and Doosan Group, to companies specifically established to run restaurants franchises, such as AmRest. In Japan, Malaysia and Indonesia, the major franchise holders are publicly listed companies. On the other hand, in smaller markets such as some Caribbean islands, the franchises may be operated by a single individual.

Contents

  • 1 Current markets
    • 1.1 Africa
    • 1.2 Asia
    • 1.3 Caribbean and South America
    • 1.4 Europe
    • 1.5 Middle East
    • 1.6 North America
    • 1.7 Oceania
  • 2 Former markets
    • 2.1 Asia
    • 2.2 Caribbean and South America
    • 2.3 Europe
    • 2.4 Oceania
  • 3 Future markets
  • 4 References

Current markets[edit]

Africa[edit]

A KFC bucket sign outside the Junction Shopping Mall in Nairobi, Kenya
Country Year
entered 		Owner/major operator Notes
 Angola 2012[7] Grupo Ibersol[7] 7 outlets. First outlet opened in Maianga in Luanda.[7]
 Botswana 1992[8] Venture Partners Botswana[9] First outlet opened in Gaborone. Currently 11 outlets.[10]
 Ghana 2011[11] Mohinani Group[11] First outlet opened in Greater Accra.[11] 15 outlets.[10]
 Ivory Coast 2018 KFC opened their first outlet in Ivory Coast in Abidjan, Marcory on 28 March 2018.[citation needed]
 Kenya 2011[12] Kuku Foods East Africa[13] First opened, briefly, in the 1970s.[14] Reopened in Nairobi in 2011.[12] 17 outlets.
 Lesotho 2012[15] KFC South Africa 5 outlets.[10]
 Malawi 2012[16] Afribrand Limited[16] First outlet in Blantyre. 2 outlets. [16]
 Mauritius 1983[17] Food & Allied Group[17] First outlet in Curepipe.[17] 21 outlets.[10]
 Morocco 2001 Americana Group[18] 12 outlets.[10]
 Mozambique 2007 Grupo Ibersol First outlet opened in Maputo. 10 outlets.[10]
 Namibia 1992[15] KFC South Africa 18 outlets.[10]
 Nigeria 2009[19] Devyani International Nigeria Limited[20] First branch opened in Lagos in 2009.[16] 27 outlets by 2014.[19]
 South Africa 1971[16] Yum Restaurants International (Pty) Ltd[21] 884 outlets. Divested its holdings from 1987 until 1994 to a holding company after U.S. Congress passed a law forbidding U.S. companies from owning South African assets.[22] KFC sold its assets to Devco, an administrative entity, which managed the trademark.[23]
 Swaziland 1993 First outlet opened in Mbabane. Seven outlets.[10]
 Tanzania 2013[5] First outlet opened in Dar es Salaam.[24]
 Tunisia 2018[25] HBG group 2 outlets in Lac 1 and La Marsa.
 Uganda 2013 Kuku Foods East Africa[26] First outlet opened in Kampala.
 Zambia 2011[27] By the end of 2011, four outlets had been opened in shopping centres in the capital city of Lusaka.
 Zimbabwe 2013[28] Takura Investments and Kelvin James[28] KFC left the country in 2008, after the franchise holder failed to meet Yum!'s standards.[28] KFC reopened in Zimbabwe in December 2013, with an outlet in Harare.Six locations.[28]
A KFC in Hohhot, Inner Mongolia, China

Asia[edit]

A KFC in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
KFC in Bonifacio Global City, Philippines
KFC in Polayathode, Kollam city; one of the largest KFC stores in Kerala state, India
A KFC outlet in Colombo, Sri Lanka
Country Year
entered 		Owner/major operator Notes
 Azerbaijan 2011[29] AFK Ltd[29] In October 2012, the world's largest KFC opened in Baku. The 1,600-square-meter outlet, with a seating capacity of 300, is housed in the city's Sabunçu rail station built in 1926. AFK Ltd reportedly invested 3 million euros to restore the nearly destroyed building.[30][31] 8 outlets.[10]
 Bangladesh 2006[32] Transcom Group[32] First outlet opened at Gulshan in 2006. As of 2018, there are 24 outlets; 21 in Dhaka, 1 in Chittagong, 1 in Sylhet and 1 in Cox's Bazar.
 Brunei 1992[citation needed] 15 outlets.
 China 1987[33] KFC China[34] KFC's largest market. The first Kentucky Fried Chicken outlet opened on Qianmen Street in downtown Beijing in 1987.[35] 5138 outlets.[10]
 Cambodia 2008 The Royal Group Established in March 2008. KFC is one of Royal Group of Companies Ltd (The Royal Group) business, a partnership with the Malaysian QSR brands and Rightlink Corporation.The Royal Group is one of the largest conglomerates in Cambodia with substantial investments in media, telecommunications, banking, education, property development and trading. Cambodia boasts only eleven branches of KFC. Ten of these are clustered in the capital Pnomh Penh.
 Hong Kong 1985[36] Birdland Ltd[36] KFC was the first American fast food chain to enter Hong Kong in 1973, with an outlet in Mei Foo Sun Chuen.[37] There were 11 outlets by mid-1974, but by September 1974 many outlets had closed.[38] The remaining 4 outlets were closed in February 1975. KFC misjudged the local market and failed to develop a suitable business model, with its takeout only stores failing to catch on.[39] Chickens imported from China were fed fishmeal, which ruined the taste.[39] The chain was reintroduced by Swire Group in September 1985, with an outlet opened on Jordan Road, at a cost of $3 million.[40] A second outlet was opened on Causeway Bay in 1986.[40] By 1995 there were 17 outlets.[41] Sold to Birdland in 1997.[40] 163 outlets.[10]
 India 1995[42] KFC India KFC opened a two-storey outlet on Brigade Road in Bangalore in June.[42] 372 outlets.[10]
 Indonesia 1979[43] PT Fastfood Indonesia[43] First outlet in Jalan Melawai, Jakarta.[43] Listed on the Jakarta Stock Exchange.[43] 465 outlets.[10] The owner is currently owned by PT Indoritel Makmur Internasional, which is also owned Indomaret. See KFC Indonesia
 Japan 1960[44] KFC Holdings Japan, Ltd[45] First outlet opened in Kobe.[44] 1181 outlets.[10]
 Kazakhstan 2010 Americana Group[18] 44 outlets.
 Kyrgyzstan 2017 3 outlets in Bishkek.
 Laos 2016[citation needed]
 Macau This KFC is located in the Galaxy Casino. See KFC Macau
 Malaysia 1973[46] QSR Brands (M) Holdings Sdn Bhd[47] The first KFC outlet was opened in 1973 on Jalan Tunku Abdul Rahman.[39] There are over 600 KFC restaurants as for 2018.[48] Kentucky Nuggets was conceived in Malaysia and then found its way to KFC worldwide. Today, Kentucky Nuggets is one of KFC's successes.[49] KFC led the chained fast food market in 2011, with 41 percent of value sales.[50]
Maldives 2018 Gama Island Food Pvt Ltd First outlet opened in Galolhu district of Malè
 Mongolia 2013[51] Tavan Bogd Group[52] Eleven outlets. See KFC Mongol
 Myanmar 2015 One outlet open in Yangon in June 30.[53] 26 outlets by September 18, 2018.
   Nepal 2009[54] Devyani International[54] Seven outlets: Six in Kathmandu,[10] at DurbarMargh , Boudha, Thimi, Maharajgunj, Labim Mall, BlueBird mall, Tripureshwar. One in Pokhara (Lakeside).[55]
 Pakistan 1997[56] Cupola Group[57] First entered Pakistan in the late 1960s to early 1970s but subsequently closed down.[58] Reopened in Gulshan-e-Iqbal in Karachi in 1997.[56] 62 outlets.[10]
 Philippines 1967[59] Wholesome Foods Inc[60] 237 outlets.[10] In June 1994, Manuel U. Agustines obtained the sole franchise over the sale and distribution of KFC products in the Philippines, under the corporate name of Quick Service Restaurants (QSR) Corporation.
 Singapore 1977[61] QSR Brands (M) Holdings Sdn Bhd[62] First outlet opened on Somerset Road in 1977.[61] 40 stores by 1992, when it was acquired by KFC International.[63] In 2002, KFC Singapore was acquired by KFC (Malaysia) Holdings Bhd.[63] 83 outlets in 2012.[64]
 South Korea 1984[65] Doosan Group[66] KFC Korea had a good startoff in the beginning, but has experienced a decline in the mid-2000s. Opening its first store in 1984 in Jongno of the capital Seoul, the outlet number has increased with its 100th store at Mokdong of Seoul (1996), and its 200th store near Seoul University (2000).[67] However, KFC's outlet closed due to failing sales, and dipped to around 120 stores by 2009.[68]

As of June 2014, KFC reopened some of its stores and operates 170 outlets in South Korea.[69]

 Sri Lanka 1995[70] Cargills Ceylon PLC[70] 27 outlets.[10]
 Taiwan 1985[71] Jardine Matheson[71] Taiwan's first KFC outlet was opened in the Ximending district of Taipei.[71] It was initially a joint venture between KFC and Uni-President Enterprises Corporation, Taiwan's largest food company, until President sold its stake in 1997. Jardine's acquired full control of the poorly performing KFC Taiwan from Yum! in 2010.[71][72] 135 outlets.[10]
 Thailand 1984[73] Yum Restaurants International (Thailand) and Central Restaurants Group[74] Originally opened in 1970 but closed down after the end of the Vietnam War in 1975.[75] KFC reopened in Thailand at CentralPlaza Lardprao in Bangkok.[54] In 2014 there were 531 outlets, 60 percent were company owned and 40 percent were owned by CRG.[76]
 Uzbekistan 2018[77] International Food Chain First outlet opened in Tashkent.[77]
 Vietnam 1997[78] KFC Vietnam First outlet opened in Ho Chi Minh City.[79] Jardine Matheson acquired a 25% stake in the company in 2011.[80] 137 outlets.[10] Euromonitor estimated that KFC has 15% of the fast food market by value in 2011, making it the leading company.[81]

Caribbean and South America[edit]

Country Year
entered 		Owner/major operator Notes
 Antigua and Barbuda KFC Antigua[82] 3 branches in Antigua in 2012.[83]
 Argentina 2010 Desarrollos Gastronomicos S.A. First opened in 1980 but closed in 1990. In 2010, KFC reopened in Buenos Aires. 4 outlets.[84][85]
 Aruba Hucor Holding Four outlets.[10]
 Bahamas 1967[86] Myers Group[87] 9 branches in 2012.[88]
 Barbados Present by 1971[89] 13 outlets.[90]
 Bolivia 2014 2 outlets. First Store in Santa Cruz de la Sierra.[91]
 Bonaire One outlet.[10]
 Brazil 1973[92] Brazil Fast Food Corporation[93] First entered the market in 1973, but eventually pulled out in 1982.[94][95] Returned in 1992.[95] The company entered a change in strategy in 1997, when it announced plans to close its 7 urban locations and relocate to 8 shopping centre locations.[96] All stores closed in 2000, but the chain returned in 2008. 44 outlets.[10]
 Cayman Islands 1976[97] KFC Cayman[97] Was the first food franchise in the Caymans.[97] 3 outlets.[10]
 Chile 1992[98] Desarrollos Gastronomicos S.A. (Degasa)[84] First store in Santiago.[99] 55 outlets.[10]
 Colombia 1993[92] INT[100] 49 outlets.[10]
 Costa Rica 1970[101] QSR International[101] First restaurant on Paseo Colon.[101] 32 outlets.[10]
 Cuba 2004 AAFES One outlet at Guantanamo Bay Naval Base.
 Curaçao Hucor Holding[102] Seven outlets.[10]
 Dominica 2010 Fine Foods Inc[103] One outlet.[10]
 Dominican Republic 1996 Kentucky Foods Group Ltd[104] 50 outlets.[10]
 Ecuador 1975[105] INT Food Services Corp. First store in Quito. KFC is the largest fast food chain in Ecuador, and is the KFC's largest market in the region with 126 outlets.[10][105]
 El Salvador 2004 Corporacion de Franquicias Americanas (CFA) 6 outlets.[10]
 Grenada 4 outlets.[10]
 Guadeloupe 4 outlets.[10]
 Guatemala 2009[106] 3 outlets.[10]
 Guyana 1994 – 2014[107];
2016[108] 		Didco[107] First outlet opened in Stabroek.[109] Reached four outlets, but the market was abandoned in 2014.[10][110] Reopened in 2016.[108]
 Jamaica 2010[111] Restaurants of Jamaica[112] First KFC at Kingston.[112] 35 outlets.[10]
 Honduras 2004[113] Grupo Comidas[113] First restaurant was in San Pedro Sula.[113] 13 outlets.[10]
 Martinique One outlet.[10]
 Panama 1969[114] Franquicias Panamenas 30 outlets.[10]
 Paraguay 2014[115] Southfood S.A.
 Peru 1981 Delosi[116] KFC is the oldest and the largest US fast food chain in Peru with 102 outlets.[117]
 Puerto Rico 1967[118] KFC Puerto Rico 92 outlets.[10]
 Saint Kitts and Nevis One outlet.[10]
 Saint Lucia Three outlets.[10]
 Sint Maarten 3 outlets.[10]
 Saint Vincent and the Grenadines 1986 Ken Boyea[119] First outlet opened in Kingstown. 3 outlets.[10]
 Suriname 1996[120] Cirkel Group[121] 3 outlets.[10]
 Trinidad and Tobago 1973[122] Prestige Holdings Limited[123] First opened in St James, a suburb of Port of Spain.[124] 56 outlets.[10]
 U.S. Virgin Islands 5 outlets.[10]
 Venezuela 1973 18 outlets.[10]
A KFC in Munich, Germany. By the time it was opened it was claimed to be the biggest KFC in the world.
A KFC restaurant at Chelyuskintsev Street in Novosibirsk, Russia

Europe[edit]

A KFC restaurant at Canterbury, England, United Kingdom
A KFC in Groningen, Netherlands
A KFC in Tours, France
Country Year
entered 		Owner/major operator Notes
 Albania 2016 First outlet in Albania opened in Tirana on April 14, 2016 at the Tirana East Gate Mall.[125] The second one opened on October 7, 2016 at the Ish-Blloku. KFC is the first international fast food chain in Albania.
 Armenia[126] 2007 9 outlets (8 in Yerevan, 1 in Vanadzor).
 Austria 2005[127] Queensway Restaurants Ltd[63] First entered the country in 1970 but withdrew.[128] Returned in 2005 with a store in Vienna.[63] 5 outlets in June 2017.[10]
 Belarus 2015 Bel Food Service LLC, CreativeFood-S-Vostok LLC 12 restaurants in August 2018.
 Bulgaria 1994[129] Samex Ltd.[129] First store opened in Sofia.[129] The first international fast food brand in Bulgaria.[129] 22 outlets.[10]
 Croatia 2011[130] AmRest[131] First store opened in Zagreb.[131] 6 outlets in Zagreb and 1 in Split.[10]
 Cyprus[132] 27 outlets.
 Czech Republic 1994[133] AmRest First outlet in Prague.[133] 88 outlets in July 2018.[134]
 Denmark 1992[135] ISKEN ApS.[135] Opened in the 1970s, but later closed. Returned in 1991, with five outlets in Greater Copenhagen and one in Aarhus, Herning, Odense as of 2018.[136] Another location is opening in Vejle in the end of 2018.
 France 2001[137] KFC France Opened in 1991, but all seven stores were closed by 1992.[137] Returned in 2001, with 211 outlets in September 2017.[137]
 Georgia 2010 6 outlets
 Germany 1968[138] KFC GB Ltd[139] First restaurant was opened at Hansaallee in Frankfurt in 1968.[140] Struggled to reach 12 stores by 1995.[141] 163 outlets by March 2018, with plans to expand to up to 500 in the next five to seven years.[142]
 Greece 1992[143] Amex S.A[143] First outlet in Piraeus near Athens. 8 outlets.
 Hungary 1992[144] Central European Franchise Group[145] The store on Király Street in Budapest was the first Central European KFC in a post-communist country.[146] The previous master franchise holder was Hemingway Holding AG.[144] 50 outlets by February 2018.[147]
 Iceland 1980[148] 8 outlets in the Reykjavík area.[10]
 Ireland 1971 KFC (GB) Ltd First opened in Phibsborough shopping centre. Major franchisees include MBCC Foods and Herbel Restaurants (Ireland) Ltd[149] 40 outlets in June 2017.[10]
 Italy 2014 KFC® Italy Srl Very first outlet opened in Naples in the 1970s, but since closed. Returned on November 21, 2014 with the first restaurant in Rome. 23 outlets in August 2018.[150] See KFC Italia
 Kosovo 2017 KAN First outlet opened in Pristina on September 28, 2016 at Albi Mall. Other outlets exist in Prizren, Mitrovica, Gjilan, Kosovo Polje, and Ferizaj. KFC is the first international fast food chain in Kosovo. 7 outlets[151]
 Latvia 2014[152] Yum International First outlet opened in August 2014 in Riga[152]
 Lithuania 2007[153] UAB Cibus Restaurants[154] Four outlets.[154]
 Macedonia 2018[155] KAN International 2 Outlets in Skopje and Tetovo.[10]
 Malta 1997[156] The Farsons Group[156] 2 outlets.[10]
 Moldova 2008[157] US Food Network[158] First opened in Chișinău in MallDova mall.[157] 2 outlets.[10]
 Netherlands 1972[159] KFC Netherlands[160] First branch was opened in Rotterdam in 1972.[137] Headquarters are in Amsterdam-Zuidoost. 54 outlets by June 2017.[10]
 Poland 1993[92] AmRest 248 outlets as of July 2018.[161]
 Portugal 1995[162] Grupo Ibersol[163] 19 outlets in June 2017.[164]
 Romania 1998[165] Sphera Franchise Group First opened in Bucharest, Magheru Blvd.[166] 70 outlets. See KFC Romania
 Russia 2000[167] Yum! International[168] Opened in Russia in 1993.[92] It closed in 1998, but the chain returned in 2000.[141] 700 outlets by September 2018. See KFC Russia
 Serbia 2007[169] AmRest[169] First store opened in Belgrade.[169] 5 outlets in Belgrade and 1 in Novi Sad.[170]
 Slovakia 2006[171] Queensway Restaurants Slovakia[172] 4 outlets in June 2017.[10] First restaurant in Trnava.[173]
 Slovenia 2006 AmRest First store on A1 motorway between Maribor and Šentilj.[174]
 Spain 1970[175] AmRest[176] 100 outlets by June 2017.[177][10]
 Sweden 2014[178] Nordic Service Partners[178] Present from 1981, but since closed. The first KFC outlet was opened in Lockarp near Malmö with a drive-through on December 31, 2014.[179] 7 outlets.
  Switzerland 2017 Present from the 1980s until 2004, but since closed. Returned in 2017 with the first store opened at the main railway sation in Geneva on December 5, 2017.3 locations as of August 2018.[180]
 Ukraine 2012[181] Global Restaurant Group[182] In 2012 the first KFC was opened in Kiev. 15 outlets in two cities.[121]
 United Kingdom 1965 KFC GB Ltd First restaurant was located in Preston, Lancashire. 842 outlets, making the United Kingdom KFC's largest market in Europe and fourth largest worldwide.[183]

Middle East[edit]

Country Year
entered 		Owner/major operator Notes
 Bahrain 1973 Americana Group[18] 22 outlets.[184]
 Egypt 1973 Americana Group[18] 156 outlets.[10]
 Iraq 2015 First Restaurant opened in Iraqi Kurdistan at Family Mall; three outlets in Erbil. KFC outlets can also be found in some Iraqi U.S. Army bases.
 Jordan 1973 Americana Group[18] 23 outlets.[10]
 Kuwait 1973[185] Americana Group[185] 66 outlets.[10]
 Lebanon 1973 Shaban Brothers Ltd[18] KFC Master Franchisee's from 1973-1993.[186] 26 outlets.[10]
 Oman 1977 Americana Group[18] 33 outlets.[10]
 Palestine 2010[187] ACRFF First branch opened September 10, 2011 at Plaza Mall in Ramallah. 9 outlets including 3 in Ramallah.[10][188][189]
 Qatar 1976 Americana Group[18] 39 outlets.[10]
 Saudi Arabia 1975 Americana Group[18] 230 outlets.[10]
 Turkey[190] 1989 Yum! Brands 113 outlets.
 United Arab Emirates 1975[191] Americana Group[18] 138 outlets.[10]

North America[edit]

Country Year
entered 		Owner/major operator Notes
 Bermuda 1975[111] KFC Bermuda[192] First KFC restaurant on Queen Street, Hamilton.[193] There is just one outlet.[194]
 Canada 1953[195] Yum Restaurants International (Canada)[196] 636 outlets. First restaurant in Calgary.[195]

Branded PFK (Poulet Frit Kentucky) in the province of Quebec, the only such alteration of the trademark in the world.[197]

 Mexico 1965[198] Premium Restaurant Brands[101] 322 outlets.[131] First outlet opened in Monterrey.[101]
 United States 1930 4,232 outlets. The franchise first opened in Salt Lake City, Utah in 1952.

Oceania[edit]

A KFC outlet in Derwent Park, a northern suburb of Hobart, Australia
Country Year
entered 		Owner/major operator Notes
 American Samoa 1984 Had two outlets. Now there is one with a Pizza Hut franchise.
 Australia 1968 KFC Australia Pty Ltd There are 650 outlets in Australia. The first Australian KFC was built and opened at Yagoona in the western suburbs of Sydney.
 Guam 1975[199] First store in Tamuning.[199] Seven outlets.[10]
 New Zealand 1971[200] Restaurant Brands[200] First store opened in Royal Oak, Auckland.[200] 100 outlets in 2013.[201]
 Northern Mariana Islands 1986 One outlet in Saipan.

Former markets[edit]

Asia[edit]

Country Year
existed 		Owner Notes
 Iran The franchise was abandoned in Iran following the 1979 Islamic revolution.[202] KFC had stressed that two stores that opened in Karaj in 2012 and Mashhad in 2014 under the KFC name were not affiliated with the company.[143]
 Israel 1993 - 2013[92] Clal Trading Limited[203] First store in Rishon LeZion.[203]
 Yemen 2013-2014 One outlet, temporarily shut down by war.[10]

Future markets[edit]

Country Year Owner Notes
 Ethiopia 2018 [citation needed]
 Gabon 2018 Opening first KFC outlet in Libreville.[citation needed]
 Rwanda 2018 [citation needed]
 Belgium 2018 Opened in the late 1970s, but closed due to declining sales.[206] In November 2016, it was announced that KFC will reopen in Belgium, but the first location has yet to be determined.[citation needed]
 Israel 2019 Operated in Israel from 1993 to 2012. KFC plans to re-enter the Israeli market in 2019 due to popularity of the chain operating in the past.[207]
 Senegal 2018 TBA Opening 2 restaurants in Dakar[208]
